bill_title: establish a four-day school week that school districts must follow in order to receive state aid to education.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a four-day school week that school districts must follow in order to receive state aid to education. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-13 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: In order to be eligible to receive general support foundation program funds, a school board shall set a school week that consists of four school days. The four school days shall include Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. The school board shall also require that all extracurricular activities take place only on Friday or Saturday of each week of the school term. Extracurricular activities may not take place on any other days of the school week. For purposes of this section, the term, extracurricular activities, includes all activities that fall outside the regular curriculum of the school district. Section 2. This Act is effective on July 1, 2005. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
